result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Berczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,300.00 to be paid within 90 days:  $300.00 to be paid to ABB and $1,000.00 to be paid to WS Machine and Tool.
Costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 2 days Huber for non-payment.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH
Concurrent with: any other sentence.
JAIL TO DO ID PROCESSING ON THIS CASE.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Oral ruling removed from the calendar.  State makes statements.  Attorney Kurzynski makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER TERM,  commences immediately.
Restitution: $300 to be paid to ABB within 90 days.  $1,000.00  to be paid to WS Machine and Tool within 90 days.  
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid within 90 days, failure to pay will result in 2 days huber consecutive.  
JAIL TO DO ID PROCESSING ON THIS CASE.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Behm moves for exclusion of the witnesses.  Witnesses are excused from the court room.  SGT Joseph G. Holz sworn in, testified.  Officer Joshua Ledzian sworn in, testified.  Judith Berczyk sworn in, testified.  Daniel P. Berczyk sworn in, testified.  Defense rests.  State recalls SGT Joseph P. Holz, testified.  State recalls Officer Joshua Ledzian, testified. Testimony closed. Court questions the parties.  Parties may file a brief supplementing the testimony.  Court takes the motion off the trial calendar.  Parties have until 5/24/2016 to file briefs.  Court to do an OTP from Stanley CI.  Oral ruling scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
